text: Using `require_css()` and `require_js()` works great on HubSpot but it looks like these functions haven't been added to the HubL Local Server. Can we have these added? :slightly_smiling_face: Also is there a way to keep track of new releases of the HubL Local Server?
good point. We're due to release a new version of that. It's been a while. I believe it will notify you on startup if there's a newer version
I am looking to display content based off a choice selection.  will need three if statements. I see where using booleans, we can use the truthy statement.
<@U2H23SN0Z> that should work if you keep your space with your elif
Does anyone have a work around to get header text closer together in outlook 2010 & 2016?

On pages in the COS the settings allow us to override the primary css file by setting it to disabled, but the blog feature only allows you to ADD stylesheets, and in three different browsers we've tested it has no impact on the page when it loads after the hs-default-custom-styles... any workarounds?

Hi <@U26C99S8P> and <@U26CZR9MW> -- it may be better to post those questions to the HubSpot Community (<http://community.HubSpot.com|community.HubSpot.com>) as our support team monitors those forums and can likely help out.
